article_title: Winning the Right to Save Your Own Life
article_text:
How far would you go to get a drug that could save your child’s life? Across an ocean? That is exactly what the federal government is forcing some American families with dying children to do.

In 2012, when Diego Morris was 11 years old, he was diagnosed with a deadly cancer in his leg called osteosarcoma. Doctors at St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital in Memphis, Tenn., removed the tumor, but the prognosis was poor. There was a...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Darcy Olsen of the Goldwater Institute writes about the Food and Drug Administration and “right to try” legislation.
twitter.title: Winning the Right to Save Your Own Life
